intro: Psychotria pulchristipula, commonly known as the white psychotria, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy texture. Psychotria pulchristipula is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
